body: Last weekend's street celebrations of democracy's return to Haiti were over in Crown Heights. The echoes of the public speeches about hope and justice had died out along Eastern Parkway in Brooklyn. But in a first-floor office on New York Avenue in Crown Heights early last week, a modest, muted project in the realization of democracy carried on.
title: Councilwoman Comforts Immigrants
